item.title: Report E-2025010086
item.description:
Report E-2025010086

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 6, 2025, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010091
item.description:
Report E-2025010091

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-08
  • City: GILSON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroMark was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the trailer floor and 20ft-by-2ft of the soil beyond the shoulder and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to a single vehicle accident that resulted in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroMark personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the recovered material into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum and two other impacted drums were overpacked into three (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010039
item.description:
Report E-2025010039

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately six (6) ounces of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal can due to blocking and bracing that resulted in the can being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010065
item.description:
Report E-2025010065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released from three (3) 2-gallon metal pails. Hepaco personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and gathered the spent rags and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged metal pails were containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest Dayton terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120514
item.description:
Report E-2024120514

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed an unknown amount of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to an unknown cause resulting in the pails being crushed. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel requested a contractor for assistance in cleaning up due to the corrosive nature of the material. The spent material was containerized it into two (2) 20-gallon poly drums. One drum contains 2 crushed pails, while the other contains an acid neutralizer and pallet chips. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010040
item.description:
Report E-2025010040

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2338 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XSW. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of FOA-3 released from a 55-gallon DF due to defective caps at the top of the drum. The release impacted the top of the drum only inside of trailer #3193592 and is staged in the yard. The Contractor recovered the “FOA-3” UN 2264 with chemical wipes and oil dry. 1-85 overpack and 1-35 DF were generated. The contractor left all waste onsite for terminal management to handle properly.
